#streamlit is used to git a user interface to the chatbot, allowing users to interact with it through a web application.
#pandas is used for data manipulation and analysis, which can be helpful for processing and managing the data that the chatbot uses to generate responses.
#numpy is used for numerical operations and can be helpful for handling large datasets or performing mathematical computations that may be necessary for the chatbot's functionality.
#matplotlib is used for data visualization, which can be useful for displaying information or insights generated by the chatbot in a more understandable and visually appealing way.
#pillow is used for image processing, which can be helpful if the chatbot needs to handle or generate images as part of its responses or interactions with users.
#langchain is a library that provides tools and functionalities for building conversational AI models, 
#langchain-community is a community-driven extension of the langchain library, which may include additional features, tools, or resources contributed by the community to enhance the capabilities of the chatbot.
#ollama is a library that provides tools for building and deploying machine learning models, which can be useful for training and deploying the chatbot's underlying AI model, allowing it to generate responses based on the data it has been trained on.
#langchain talks to ollama to get the response from the model and then displays it on the streamlit interface for the user to see.
#streamlit --> langchain --(talks to)--> ollama --(gets response from model)--> langchain --(displays response on)--> streamlit
streamlit
pandas
numpy
matplotlib
pillow
langchain
langchain-community
ollama
